headline: Boeing Beat Lockheed Martin for the Pentagon’s Jet Fighter Contract. Here’s What to Know.
summary: Boeing  scored a contract to build the Pentagon’s next-generation jet fighter, beating out rival  Lockheed Martin   The deal has big implications for Boeing’s bottom line, its beleaguered defense unit and the jet maker’s strained relationship with the Trump administration.  Boeing shares rose 3% following the decision Friday, while Lockheed shares fell nearly 6%.  The Pentagon wants the new F-47 jet fighter to replace the stealthy F-22, a Lockheed aircraft, and fly alongside semiautonomous drones that are already well into development.

The Pentagon wants the new F-47 jet fighter to replace the stealthy F-22, a Lockheed aircraft, and fly alongside semiautonomous drones that are already well into development.

headline: Lockheed Stock Dropped, Boeing Popped on News of New Jet Fighter
summary: The U.S. military awarded  Boeing  a key new contract to build the latest generation of jet fighters over rival  Lockheed  Martin.  Boeing stock added 3.1% on Friday, closing at $178.11, while the  and  added 0.1%.  Lockheed shares dropped 5.8% to $439.70.

summary: Investors in the troubled aerospace giant Boeing (BA) received some good news on Friday when President Donald Trump awarded it a contract to build “a lot” of F-47 fighter jets for the U.S. Air Force — and possibly its allies.

headline: Why Boeing Rallied Today
summary: Shares of aircraft manufacturer Boeing (NYSE: BA) were rallying on Friday, up 5.9% as of 1:45 p.m. ET.  It has been a tough stretch for Boeing over the past few years and even in its most recent fourth quarter.  On Friday, President Donald Trump announced Boeing as the winner of the $20 billion initial contract to engineer and manufacture the F-47, which will be the DOD's sixth-generation warfighter, following the F-35.

headline: Boeing (BA) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of aerospace and defense company Boeing (NYSE:BA) jumped 5.7% in the afternoon session after the company announced that it secured the contract to produce the next generation of fighter jets for the U.S. military, successfully outbidding competitor Lockheed Martin. The contract, known as Next Generation Air Dominance, or NGAD, is supposed to help build jets (F-47) that will accompany a future fleet of drone aircraft to protect the US against its adversaries. headline: FedEx orders Boeing 777 and ATR cargo aircraft, delays MD-11 retirements

headline: Trump awards Boeing a $20B contract to build Air Force fighter jet
summary: President Trump announced that Boeing (BA) will be building the US Air Force's new fighter jet, awarding the aircraft manufacturer a $20 billion military contract. Brad Smith reports more on this news on Yahoo Finance's Wealth. This all comes well after Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has pressured the US Department of Defense to reduce its military spending budget by 8%. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.
